harbours_ports.name: Thoris-Heracleion & Canopus
harbours_ports.description: Sunken Ports of the Nile Delta

harbours_ports.name: Perunefer
harbours_ports.description: Memphis Royal Harbour. Launched Egypt's navy.

harbours_ports.name: Abu Sha'ar
harbours_ports.description: Ptolemaic-Roman Naval Base. Launched Egypt's navy.

harbours_ports.name: Wadi al-Jarf
harbours_ports.description: Oldest known harbor. Khufu's era c. 2600 BCE

harbours_ports.name: Ayn Sokhna
harbours_ports.description: Old Kingdom Copper Trade Port. Handled copper, incense, and exotic goods from the Sinai and Punt.

harbours_ports.name: Myos Hormos
harbours_ports.description: Main Roman Red Sea port. Egyptian ports used by the Romans for trade with India, Arabia, and East Africa.

harbours_ports.name: Rhodes
harbours_ports.description: The Ptolemaic Naval Base. A key ally of Ptolemaic Egypt, Rhodes housed Egyptian-funded projects and was crucial in Mediterranean trade.
